channel.title: polyvox
channel.description: An unscripted and irreverent conversation between three or more folks that work in IT but would rather create content for you to enjoy.

custom_elements.itunes:summary: An unscripted and irreverent conversation between three or more folks that work in IT but would rather create content for you to enjoy.

items.title: Beefsteak Handshake
items.description: In our inaugural podcast, we start with the underhandedness of SourceForge and conclude with vending machines in public restrooms.

custom_elements.itunes:subtitle: Greeting one another and the Internet with an inaugural podcast.

itunes:summary._cdata:
What did we talk about?
  • The recent underhandedness of SourceForge.net and how it relates to Pulp Fiction
  • Bryan's new Apple Watch
  • Starbuck's, banks, Amazon, and all of the other Big Brothers
  • Blackpowder, gunpowder and shooting stuff
  • Bryan's upcoming birthday
  • Keanu Reeves and Shia LeBouf
  • Using smartphones for their smart and not their phone
  • Long-format writing
  • Gonzo journalism
  • Our first vinyl records, cassette tapes, and CDs
  • Underdog
  • The mysteries of mattresses and pillows
  • Vending machines in public restrooms
  • The Ha' penny

And, a listener submitted photo!

items.title: Bryan Has a Birthday
items.description: The sequel to the first episode!

custom_elements.itunes:subtitle: Happiness is having a rare steak, a bottle of scotch, and a dog to eat the rare steak.

itunes:summary._cdata:
Another couple of hours of pure, ignorant bliss filled by...
  • Heather learns about advanced microphone setup
  • Getting used to our voices
  • Bryan admires Curtis' T-shirt (which you can't see!)
  • Biomimetics as a science, an art, and a company name
  • Let's pluralize octopus!
  • COUGH!
  • Heather presents NOT THE NEWS
  • Revisit the meaning of "NOT THE NEWS" with the 2015 Texas pool party incident as the example
  • Civil disobedience: structured vs. unstructured
  • More sight gags that you can't see!
  • Samsung Galaxy Note Edge
  • Heather's and Curtis' life advice for Bryan on his birthday
  • Sleeping gear
  • Dave Chappelle making history

items.title: What if We Had a Sponsor?

custom_elements.itunes:subtitle: No, wait! We're not corporate sell-outs!

itunes:summary._cdata:
Give me liberty or give me...
  • Who would we want as our sponsor?
    • Budlight Lime (probably not)
    • John Oliver
    • Hollowdeck Press
    • Halliburton
    • formerly the Canadian Tourism Commission
    • Happy Madison Productions
    • Donald Trump
    • Audible
    • SPANX
    • Gatorade
    • Ettore
    • J. B. Rope Supply
    • Skyline High Rise Services
    • Chris Pratt, PLEASE!
  • Short pants
  • SeaWorld
  • Drew and Adam
  • Amazon Prime fails Bryan
  • Follow-up on the purity of the Weather Channel's line-up
  • The redemption of Brian Williams
  • Â¡Fireworks!
  • The Myth of Mythbusters
  • Undergarments
  • Follow-up on Heather's story-for-a-house
  • The Sinking of the RMS Lusitania
  • SKINNY JEANS WARNING!
  • This Is Where I Leave You
  • Curtis got a haircut
  • Little kid English
  • Steinbeck
  • Sky-scraper window washers
  • Sensory deprivation booths
  • Mani/pedi salon experiences
  • Fireworks
  • Jurassic World
  • Miguel Rivera playing Beat It

items.title: Hawai'i, Sorkinville, and Politics! ... oh my

custom_elements.itunes:subtitle: We're now selling Roman Catholic prayer candles with Saint Machete on them.

itunes:summary._cdata:
A tea candle is not a candle...
  • Hawai'i
  • Sorkinville
  • Heather becomes a bookie
  • The amazing Steve Buscemi
  • The amazing Danny Trejo
  • 2016 U.S. Presidential Politics

Episode Scorecard:
  • Black Mirror: 1 love, 1 meh, 2 wtf?
  • Danger Five: 2 love, 0 meh, 2 wtf?
  • The Leftovers: 1 love, 1 meh, 2 wtf?
  • Fringe: 1 love, 1 meh, 2 wtf?
Also
  • Heather gets locked out of her house
  • Piracy, the old-fashioned way
  • Camping in Bosnia
  • Foreign language childhood songs
  • Old people, old movies
  • Cartoons of the 90s
